abstract: Verified Identity Pass, which offered a service to send airline passengers to the head of the security line for a fee, has been sold.
snippet: Verified Identity Pass, which offered a service to send airline passengers to the head of the security line for a fee, has been sold.
lead_paragraph: Verified Identity Pass, a company founded by the entrepreneur Steven Brill, offered travelers a tempting proposition: pay up to $199 a year, submit to a fingerprint and iris scan, and skip to the front of interminable airport security lines.

headline.main: ‘Clear’ Security Service May Return at Airports
headline.print_headline: ‘Clear’ Security Service May Return at Airports
